generif.text: Identification of endothelial cell genes expressed in an in vitro model of angiogenesis: induction of ESM-1, (beta)ig-h3, and NrCAM.
demonstrate that a small 139-bp core promoter fragment contains information for endothelial-cell-specific expression in vitro
Hhex-mediated repression of ESM-1 is critical for the normal function of the vascular endothelium and for tumor vasculogenesis.
Endocan is overexpressed in non-small cell lung tumors compared with healthy lung and probably represents a response of tumoral endothelium to proangiogenic growth factor stimulation.

VEGF-A is a specific inducer of endocan transcription which is translated into increased protein levels in VEGF-A treated endothelial cells. Increased endocan protein expression in human renal cancer suggests a role in tumor growth.
Endocan-microvessel density was a significant factor to predict the prognosis of hepatocellular carcinoma patients after curative hepatectomy.
Incubation of lymphatic endothelial cells (LEC) with ESM-1 increased the stimulatory effects of both VEGF-A and VEGF-C on LEC proliferation and migration, whereas ESM-1 alone had no effect
The expression of endocan is down-regulated in colorectal cancer and is positively correlated with the tissue differentiation in colorectal cancer.
This study suggests that endocan is associated with abnormal vasculature in high-grade gliomas.
The expression of ESM-1 is significantly up-regulated in hepatocellular carcinoma, and is associated with angiogenesis and tumor invasion.
endocan is overexpressed in patients with renal clear cell carcinomas
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
Clinical trial of gene-disease association and gene-environment interaction. (HuGE Navigator)
Higher expression of the ESM1 is associated with gastric cancer.
Over-expression of the Endocan gene in endothelial cells from hepatocellular carcinoma is associated with angiogenesis and tumour invasion.
Gene silencing of ESM-1 decreased cell survival, migration, an invasion in hepatocellular carcinoma.
endocan may act as a marker for angiogenesis or oncogenesis and could be regarded as a candidate gene for inflammatory tissue, neoplasia, tumor development and metastasis
increased expression on microvascular endothelial cells following peripheral blood stem cell harvesting in patients with multiple myeloma
Data suggest that serum endocan is a disease marker in AML.
The immunolabeling of endocan in endothelial cells may therefore appear to be a relevant marker of aggressive behavior in pituitary tumors.
ESM-1 overexpression in HCT-116 cells enhanced cell proliferation through the Akt-dependent activation of NF-kappa-B pathway.

results showed that ESM-1 is significantly overexpressed, which is regulated by HIF-1alpha in colorectal cancer (CRC) patients, and can be used as a potential biomarker and a therapeutic target for CRC
Endocan is upregulated on tumor vessels in invasive bladder cancer where it mediates VEGF-A-induced angiogenesis.
p14 endocan fragment represents a novel interesting biomarker which could participate to the pathogenesis of sepsis

Significant correlation between LMP1 and endocan expression was observed (p<0.0001). Moreover, NPC patients with endocan expression were found to have a shorter survival than NPC patients without endocan expression expression.
Suggest that increased circulating endocan levels represent a new marker in patients with essential hypertension.
This study shows endocan can elicit severe inflammatory responses and inhibiting endocan release offers a potential strategy for treating sepsis.
Endocan can be used as strong and significant predictor of sepsis severity and outcome.
Our findings suggest that upregulation of endocan expression in proliferative diabetic retinopathy could be a reflection of endothelial cell activation associated with angiogenesis.
endocan expression was found to be an independent prognostic factor for survival and Endocan promoted gastric cancer cell proliferation
This study suggests that serum ESM-1 level is increased in patients with gastric cancer
Endocan is a promising biomarker to predict the disease severity and mortality in patients with acute respiratory distress syndrome.
Endocan, a new biomarker of endothelial pathology, is significantly increased in patients with acute coronary syndrome but does not correlate with severity of coronary artery disease.
Median maternal plasma endocan concentrations were higher in preeclampsia and lower in acute pyelonephritis with bacteremia than in uncomplicated pregnancy.
study suggest that amlodipine and valsartan decrease endocan levels in newly diagnosed hypertensive

Elevated endocan levels were more strongly associated with disease severity among Johnson Syndrome, Toxic Epidermal Necrolysis subjects than among less severe allergic reactions with skin involvement.
this study did not demonstrate any significant difference between endocan levels of women with pre-eclampsia and those with uncomplicated pregnancies
Endocan levels are related to endothelial dysfunction in humans in vivo during systemic inflammation evoked by experimental endotoxemia
Results reveal a novel pathway for endocan in the control of tumor growth, which involves inflammatory cells of the innate immunity.
In bacteremic cases, serum endocan levels in bacteremia tended to be higher than in non-bacteremic cases.

higher levels of Endocan-1 were found in maternal plasma in pre-eclamptic group; placental Endocan-1 levels were lower in pre-eclampsia and fetal levels did not show any difference between groups; upregulation of maternal plasma Endocan-1 in the pre-eclamptic group was observed when when stratified in relation to gestational age, systolic blood pressure and proteinuria
Suggest that serum endocan concentrations are elevated in patients with type 2 diabetes and decrease following anti-hyperglycemic treatment.
Detection of ESM-1 levels in the serum may serve as a tumor biomarker for assessing prognosis in colorectal cancer.
Serum ESM1 was significantly lower in type 2 diabetes patients than in controls.
Serum endocan level is independently correlated with the presence and severity of coronary artery disease in hypertension patients.
Serum endocan concentrations were significantly elevated in women with pre-eclampsia versus normotensive controls, and concentrations seem to be associated with the severity of the disease.
study showed that higher endocan levels were significantly and independently related to the presence of slow coronary flow.
Endocan is an inflammatory marker released by the endothelium and is associated with endothelial dysfunction and atherosclerosis in patients with systemic lupus erythematosus.
Dopamine agonist resistance-related ESM1 promotes the angiogenesis and tumor cells growth of prolactinomas, suggesting that ESM1 may be a novel therapeutic target for prolactinomas.
Serum ESM-1 levels correlate with stress hyperglycemia in patients with STEMI and are associated with short-term prognosis.
Endocan could be a common predictor of the endothelium-dependent inflammatory processes, rather than related with specific risk factors in coronary artery disease and microvascular angina.
Serum and urinary endocan concentrations are significantly elevated in patients with bladder cancer.
serum levels of endocan, a new biomarker of endothelial dysfunction, increase in obstructive sleep apnea subjects.
Endocan may play a role in the progression of pregnancy and has a potential to be a new marker for the detection of pre-eclampsia

Results found that serum endocan levels were significantly lower in Alzheimer's disease (AD) patients with depression than in AD patients without depression or healthy controls suggesting that serum endocan levels might be associated with depression in AD.
suggest that serum ESM-1 level may be a novel endothelial dysfunction biomarker
Systemic inflammation may be responsible for the rise in endocan levels following cardiopulmonary bypass.
The levels of ESM1, CLDN5, IL-1beta, IL-6, and TNF-alpha were significantly higher in the migraine attack group than in the control group
Endocan-expressing microvessel density significantly correlates with the expression of VEGF and VEGFR2 and is a valuable prognostic factor for survival in human gastric cancer.
The distribution of Gleason score and biochemical failure rate were significantly higher in patients with serum endocan >/=1.8 ng/mL (p = 0.031 and p = 0.047).
These results suggest human cytomegalovirus infection leads to glioma progression through an upregulation of endocan and the secretion of inflammatory cytokines.
High ESM1 expression is associated with Meningiomas and Gliomas.
endocan plays an anti-carcinogenic role in gastric cancer development and progression and might serve as a prognostic biomarker as well as a potential therapeutic target for gastric cancer.
Studied serum endocan levels in endometrial and ovarian cancer. Serum endocan levels were significantly higher in the entire patient group than in the controls.

Endocan expression is increased in the human placenta from obese women with gestational diabetes, and in response to pro-inflammatory stimuli. Loss-of-function studies in villous trophoblast cells and HUVECs revealed that endocan is not directly involved in the genesis or in the expression of pro-inflammatory cytokines induced by LPS or IL-1beta.
this study shows that endocan may play an important role in the development of connective tissue disease related pulmonary arterial hypertension
Subclinical hypothyroidism is associated with increased levels of serum endocan, dimethylarginine, and TGF-beta, which are new markers for endothelial dysfunction.
Physical activity increases circulating endocan level.
These findings provide the first evidence that the imbalance of MMP-9/TIMP-1, is one of the regulation mechanisms by which ESM1 promotes tumorigenicity and metastasis of prostate cancer cells.
Circulating P-selectin levels were closely associated with endocan levels in obese children and adolescents with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease.
suggest that measurement of endocan level may help clinicians to predict the development of coronary collateral circulation in patients with stable coronary artery disease
The results suggest that endocan may have a role in the pathogenesis of pterygium.
Severe erectile dysfunction was associated with higher serum endocan levels than less severe erectile dysfunction or healthy controls.

These results are consistent with the view that endocan measured in ICU patients is intact, stable, and accurate. Then, the low endocan level observed in ICU patients who developed acute respiratory distress syndrome is likely to be reliable.
This study showed that ESM-1 level in pleural effusion could be a potential diagnostic and prognostic marker in NSCLC patients with MPE.
serum pro-BNP and endocan levels were increased in hemodynamically significant patent ductus arteriosus infants before medical treatment and decreased in the days followed appropriate treatment

Serum endocan levels >/= 2.05 ng/ml had a sensitivity of 76.1% and specificity of 85% for the diagnosis of bacterial infection in decompensated cirrhotic patients. The endocan measured at admission is a good clinical parameter predicting the occurrence of infection in these patients. Elevated endocan may reflect the degree of endothelial cell injury by a systemic inflammatory response.
endocan levels are higher in patients who require mechanical ventilation in severe sepsis
elevated expression on epidermal keratinocytes and dermal endothelial cells in lesional skin of atopic dermatitis; decreased expression in atopic dermatitis sera
Demonstrate an increased Endocan serum level in NAFLD patients, higher in those with type 2 diabetes mellitus and/or NASH because of an endothelial dysfunction in these pathologies.
glomerular-derived Esm-1 as a potential non-invasive biomarker of diabetic nephropathy

Endocan expression was correlated with poor clinical outcomes in patients with Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumors . The results indicated that endocan expression may be a reliable marker for predicting tumor recurrence in patients with PNETs.
A strong negative correlation was found between serum endocan levels and peak systolic velocity in men with severe erectile dysfunction.
Plasma ESM-1 is a novel biomarker for predicting the T status in OSCC patients.

ESM1 expression correlates with Gleason grade/score and with androgen receptor expression in prostate carcinoma tissue, so ESM1 should also be considered as a biomarker for diagnosis of prostate cancer.

The correlation between the secretion of endocan and that of IL-6 by endothelial cells suggests that endocan can be used as a predictive marker of inflammation for the quality assessment of transfusion grade PLTs
Endocan levels are higher in patients with large-artery atherosclerotic stroke and can help in predicting the short-term unfavourable outcome.
The cutoff serum level of endocan predicting AD was >288.94 ng/mL in receiver operating characteristic curve analysis
serum levels were significantly lower in liver cirrhosis patients with cirrhotic cardiomyopathy
Further studies should investigate the prognostic value of the magnitude of postoperative Endocan concentration after cardiac surgery.
Endocan values were not significantly correlated with the duration of CPB.
Plasma ESM-1 levels are decreased during pregnancy and increased in early- and late-onset preeclampsia. The source of ESM-1 is probably not the placenta, but most likely maternal endothelial cells.

Study found significant differences in median (interquartile) endocan serum level in women with intrauterine growth restriction (IUGR) and control groups Endocan is likely involved in the pathogenesis of IUGR in pregnant women and possibly is a useful marker of endothelial dysfunction in these cases.

Serial endocan concentration meets the major requirements for predicting outcome in patients with severe sepsis. An assay of endocan concentration may be a good prognostic biomarker in the clinic for severe sepsis.
endocan values of less than 2.54ng/mL may be predictive of Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome in severe sepsis and septic shock
Serum endocan can correlate with erectile dysfunction (ED) severity and carotid intima-media thickness. In addition, it has a predictive value for cardiovascular risk in ED patients.

ESM-1 is significantly upregulated by the HIF-1alpha/VEGF pathway under intermittent hypoxia in endothelial cells, playing a critical role in enhancing adhesion between monocytes and endothelial cells.
Results show the endocan level in peripheral blood significantly elevated in patients newly diagnosed with multiple myeloma (MM), and associated with myeloma-specific clinical parameters.
high Endocan level is associated with poor lung functions and severity of asthma in children
Blood endocan level is increased in polycystic ovary syndrome.
Results show that aerum ESM-1 levels were significantly higher in the idiopathic sudden sensorineural hearing loss group than the control group which may confirm endothelial dysfunction involvement.

Findings demonstrated for the first time that enriched functional ECs are derived through cell reprogramming and ESM1 signaling, opening the horizon for drug screening and cell-based therapies for vascular diseases.
Novel useful markers for follow-up of necrotizing enterocolitis: endocan and interleukin-33.
Serum endocan concentration and its correlation with severity of hypertensive disorders in pregnancy.
Elevated circulating endocan levels are associated with reduced lung ventilation function in COPD patients and those with acute exacerbation of COPD.
Endocan levels were associated with the development of Ventilator-Associated Pneumonia.

Serum endocan level shows a correlation with deteriorated aortic elastic properties, and could b a surrogate marker of escalating aortic stiffness in patients with newly diagnosed essential hypertension.

There was a significant change in serum hs-CRP, endocan levels, and LVEF before and after coronary artery by-pass surgery of acute coronary syndrome patients. Serum endocan level was significantly decreased after successful operation. Thus, endocan may be an important biomarker in terms of clinical use as an indicator of successful reperfusion.

the results of the present study showed that the knockdown of ENDOCAN inhibited cell growth and induced cell apoptosis, which was accompanied by the inhibition of NF-kappaB activity in myeloid leukemia cells, indicating that ENDOCAN is a promising therapeutic target in leukemia.

circulating ESM-1 showed higher discriminatory accuracy in predicting the presence of obstructive sleep apnea

In patients with STEMI [ST-segment elevation myocardial infarction], the levels of endocan and galectin-3 may be helpful in identifying patients with a higher risk of insufficient myocardial perfusion and worse clinical outcome after PPCI [primary percutaneous coronary intervention].

interpro.desc: Growth factor receptor cysteine-rich domain superfamily

name: endothelial cell specific molecule 1
summary: This gene encodes a secreted protein which is mainly expressed in the endothelial cells in human lung and kidney tissues. The expression of this gene is regulated by cytokines, suggesting that it may play a role in endothelium-dependent pathological disorders. The transcript contains multiple polyadenylation and mRNA instability signals. Two transcript variants encoding different isoforms have been found for this gene. [provided by RefSeq, Oct 2008].
